title: Introduction
content:
This gap analysis report provides a comprehensive assessment of the current travel policy against industry best practices and compliance requirements. The analysis covers multiple categories including air travel, ground transportation, hotel accommodations, and expense management.

The assessment reveals several areas where the policy demonstrates strong alignment with best practices, while identifying opportunities for enhancement in specific categories.

title: Methodology
content:
The gap analysis was conducted using a systematic approach that evaluated the policy across multiple dimensions:

• Policy Coverage: Assessment of policy comprehensiveness across travel categories
• Compliance Alignment: Evaluation against regulatory requirements and industry standards
• Risk Management: Analysis of risk mitigation strategies and controls
• Cost Optimization: Review of cost management practices and efficiency measures

Each category was scored on a scale of 0-100, with detailed findings and recommendations provided for areas requiring attention.

title: Executive Summary
content:
Overall Assessment Score: 88%

The policy demonstrates strong alignment with industry best practices across most categories. Key strengths include comprehensive coverage of travel arrangements, robust risk management protocols, and effective cost control measures.

Areas for improvement include enhanced sustainability practices, expanded digital booking capabilities, and strengthened compliance monitoring mechanisms.
